results.title: Dear mum
results.creator_credit: Don Marley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Cinesound Movietone
results.brief_description: A highly entertaining and at times funny film about the life of a young soldier in the army. He writes to tell his mum all the great things that happen in the army - like seeing the country; friendship; a lot of spare time and the satisfaction from working as a group.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Don Marley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and Cinesound Movietone

results.title: Dear mother
results.creator_credit: Judith Mahfoud and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Life wasn’t meant to be easy, but it still can be profoundly beautiful. Judith delves into the childhood of her mother, to try to understand her better so she can pass this knowledge to her five sons and to honour the life of her mother, who grew up feeling like she was nobody’s child.

results.title: Dear God in heaven
results.creator_credit: Ian Fowler, Rufus Guds and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: Heaven rests precariously upon the ozone layer. When a suburban family habitually uses fluorocarbon propelled aerosols the direct result is the loss of God’s personal TV When the situation worsens he calls for the aid of Jesus and the apostles. Cast includes Ted Venn, Evonne Shields, Nigel Buesst, Jan Marnell.

results.title: Dear diary = Caro diario
results.creator_credit: Nanni Moretti, Nella Banfi, Studio Canal, La Sept Cinema, Banfilm and Sacher Film
results.brief_description: Moretti’s intimate and hilarious film diary, which follows the idiosyncratic Italian director’s personal experiences over 18 months, was received rapturously at Cannes where it won the Best Director Award. The film is divided into three chapters: in the first, we follow Moretti on his Vespa through the streets of Rome; in the second, he escapes with a friend to the beautiful Eolian islands; and in the third we see his dealings with conventional and alternative doctors. In Italian with English subtitles.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nanni Moretti, Nella Banfi, Studio Canal, La Sept Cinema, Banfilm and Sacher Film

results.title: Dear diary
results.creator_credit: David Shepard, Debra Franco and Copperfield Films
results.brief_description: Companion film to “Am I normal?” Raising issues and answering questions relating to female puberty, in a humorous and entertaining manner. Provides information on body changes, maturation, peer pressure and self-image. TEACHER PREVIEW RECOMMENDED.

results.title: Dean and Donna
results.creator_credit: Sandra Richardson, Ian Munro, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “I myself”.
Part of a series designed to facilitate discussion of various issues and themes related to social education, human relations and personal development and designed for use with primary-school and lower secondary school children in the 8 to 14 year age range. This part looks at Donna and Dean who are learning to adjust to different ‘blended family’ situations. Donna and her natural brother Scott have joined older brothers and sisters. Donna is now no longer the eldest. Dean lives with his father and new step-mother. They have recently had a baby. Explores the feelings they express while they are seeking to make the necessary readjustments.

results.title: Dealing with office fires [rev.ed]
results.brief_description: This video looks at immediate response to fires which may occur in the office environment. It shows the correct use of different types of fire extinguishers with their distinct ASA labels, and fixed hose reels. Contains useful advice on personal safety issues, evacuation procedures and maintenance of fire equipment.

results.title: Dealing with office fires
results.brief_description: This program shows office staff how fires can be extinguished when you know what to do. It features the water hose reel and three extinguishers commonly used on infant fires. The safety of all people, informing the fire brigade, possibly evacuation and attacking the fire are all dealt with. This will give staff confidence to act appropriately and will show how simple it is to pull the pin and squeeze the lever.
